action.action-desc: Mr. Vargas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Army, acting through the Chief of Engineers, to carry out a program to prevent flooding and wastewater, sewage, trash, and sediment spills in the Tijuana River Valley, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sewage Free Tijuana River Valley Act of 2017.

section.header: Prevention of flooding and wastewater, sewage, trash, and sediment spills in Tijuana River Valley

subsection.text: The Secretary shall carry out a program to enhance the physical infrastructure in both the United States and Mexico to prevent flooding and wastewater, sewage, trash, and sediment spills in the Tijuana River Valley.
The purposes of the program include—

paragraph.text: coordinating restoration and protection activities among Mexican, Federal, State, local, and regional entities and conservation partners relating to the Tijuana River Valley; and
carrying out coordinated restoration and protection activities, and providing for technical assistance, relating to the Tijuana River Valley.

subsection.text: In establishing the program, the Secretary shall consult, as appropriate, with—

paragraph.text: the heads of Federal agencies, including—

subparagraph.text: the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection; and
the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service;

paragraph.text: the United States Commissioner, International Boundary and Water Commission, United States and Mexico;
the San Diego Regional Water Quality Control Board;
the Tijuana River National Estuarine Research Reserve;
other public agencies and organizations with authority for the planning and implementation of conservation strategies relating to the Tijuana River Valley in both the United States and Mexico.

subsection.text: The non-Federal share of the cost of any project carried out with grant assistance made available under the program shall be 50 percent.
In this section, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.text: The term Mexican governments means the Federal, State, and local governments of the United Mexican States.

The term restoration and protection means the conservation, stewardship, and enhancement of the physical infrastructure in both the United States and Mexico to prevent flooding and wastewater, sewage, trash, and sediment spills in the Tijuana River Valley.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Army, acting through the Chief of Engineers.

The term Tijuana River Valley means the planning area in San Diego County bounded by the city of Imperial Beach and the Otay Mesa-Nestor community to the north, the San Ysidro community to the east, Mexico to the south, and Border Field State Park and Imperial Beach to the west.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $50,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2018 through 2022.
